Naturally, I'd heard much about NC BBQ, and while its anti-tomato pro-vinegar reputation didn't actually sound all that great to me, I was still anxious to sample the fare that has earned the devotion of so many.  I had the pulled pork "classic" sandwich, which states that it is prepared topped with cole slaw. I had to prompt my server to do this, however. As any good BBQ afficionado knows, this is God's own preparation for pulled pork, an idea original to North Carolina and perhaps one of the best things in BBQ. I guess the masses probably don't know this, as the server seemed almost confused when I asked for it and of course, in my own experience, when I tell people this they almost universally give me a suspicious stare of revulsion. Until they try it, that is - but I'm digressing.   Pulled pork is also remarkably difficult to screw up, so it's usually my baseline. I ordered the mac and cheese as my side dish as I will always do when it is available, unless it has the telltale fluorescence of the boxed variety. As a bonus, all meals are served with a battered, deep-fried pickle. Sweet!  As I suspected, the vinegary flavor of the pulled pork, which was very competently prepared, was off-putting to me. The taste of the smoked meat itself was nearly impeccable - perhaps a tad oversmoked - but the vinegar (I think unsurprisingly) leaps to the front of your palate and screams LOOK AT ME LOOK AT ME YEAH THAT'S RIGHT DOG THAT'S HOW WE ROLL IN NORTH CAROLINA.   I didn't care for it.  The mac and cheese, while delicious, suffered from being overcooked and mushy in texture. The pickle, while a great idea, was not that good. It had been sitting around though, so maybe it's better fresh, but I think deep fried pickles are better as chips than as a spear.  In summary, I think perhaps the Charlotte airport is not representative of the best BBQ that North Carolina has to offer but I think it did reinforce in me the notion that I had going in. This vinegary flavor profile is either an acquired taste or perhaps just something that can only impress those who grew up with it. I won't give up on NC BBQ altogether, but color me relatively unimpressed so far.

d6f5lHVqpQo5SvgfybXPTw.text: Breakfast review. Had a long layover so had time to "shop around" ended up here for their breakfast and was not disappointed! They have oatmeal, grits, biscuits and gravy scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, fruit, Greek yogurt, country fried steak..lots of options and its cheap:) I ended up here because the whole food court area was full of people eating their food!

9QtjMdkgS4AmgskoIg5low.text: If you like overpriced BBQ with an extra slathering of salt on everything, this is the place for you! Even the sweet potato fries were bad and I didn't think that was possible :(

xGP32UFb1HBnBscpLomONw.text: Ok for airport food I suppose. Everything is made offsite, frozen and then shipped here. They probably get away with cooking collard greens in house to say they make food here. Corn bread definitely has been defrosted, v dry. Ribs overcooked and dehydrated. Brisket old and Mac and cheese stodgy. Rip off.

Ma9vfbdPbAHVkY-VySK1Lg.text: We had the dirty mac and cheese and it was really great! I had a Bloody Mary and it was also delicious, spoil alert it was $14 . Our server was Stephani and she was wonderful. I would come back!

gpcl0zwGPvfMOcV5uz2Q3w.text: Pretty good all tasty and nothing dry, The biscuit was moist, really impressed with "airport" food :)

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carolina breakfast platter!

9arI-4X20XVNf9ivMBPQHA.text: It's okay. It's airport food. Bland greens, I suggest skipping that. Beef brisket.. Well it's airport food, it's food, it's barbeque. It's better than bland airport pizza or other bland airport food.

aJ9nh7ghJ7peTjZXwp-fQw.text: I hvnt eaten at lots of airport places because I think they all suck however this BBQ place changed my mind. Its great food with reasonable airport food pricing.  The BBQ ribs are great, juicy and savory sweet.  The platter was great too, you get a choice of three out of four meats : turkey (very juicy), pulled pork(a little dry and not enough sauce), beef briskest (juicy n tender and ALL That!!) or BBQ ribs (the BEST of all!!!) plus you get to choose a side, anything but the corn bread, its dry and tasteless.   For $11.99 for the platter, its really filling and reasonable pricing.

K_9vSkaHWdrlj4Y71hePJA.text: I do not recommend going here if you're looking for good BBQ. I'm from the south and this is not the best the south has to offer. Bad and overpriced BBQ. I ordered the chicken and ribs platter with green beans and cornbread. The ribs were babybacks and were over done, dry and bland. The same goes for the chicken, dark meat, a thigh and leg. There was no smoke to the meats and the rub was very sweet and lacked spices. The sauce that everyone complains about not getting enough is awful. Very sweet and very sour, it's like eating a sour patch. The green beans were overcooked and very soggy. The one thing I was looking forward to was the cornbread which disappointed me. The cornbread was cake-like but lacked sugar. In the end, I wasted $20 on cold, dry, tasteless, under seasoned food.

ZQwvYcF67Tnq4ix3LBTRWA.text: As a frequent traveler of US Airways, my visits to CLT are numerous.  Yet, every time I'm there, I find myself pulled to get some of this Carolina Pit BBQ.  The Pounder Platter was my go-to guy, which affords you a choice of 3 meats, leaving the carbs to a minimum.  Brisket, chicken, pulled pork, it's allllllll good.  Nowadays, I'm more drawn to the ribs n chicken platter.  You're getting a half rack of baby backs, plus a leg quarter, choice of side, cornbread, and fried pickle (blech).  Add a gargantuan bottle of Fiji to the order and you're close to $20, for airport food, it's tops.  I do wish they were more generous with their BBQ sauce, but that's really the only blemish on an otherwise delicious record.  50 reviews!  Hi-ho, silver!

_3imtKKEB1RwQ2Vx7AsVOw.text: Brisket dinner 2 sides $11  Brisket was good!  worth the $$ The Mac & cheese was so so.. I did t finish it  The mash potato were good but not great! Still love me some BBQ Brisket !!

bDgv-_Rw1f0ciLEYRJwV3Q.text: I always hope the food will be awesome and every time I'm disappointed. But average BBQ is better than most airport food options...

rmZb1jBWeM3nCu_pkv_yAQ.text: Had the TJ's pulled pork platter with two sides, Mac n cheese and fried okra. Enjoyed both sides but the pork was pretty oily. Cornbread and fries pickle were both good, as were the hush puppies my husband enjoyed. It gets three stars because the main dish, which should be the best thing at a BBQ place, was underwhelming. Of course, I'm used to Archer's BBQ so it's not  fair to compare!

5rHE-ptb4WXpEDpHo2Xang.text: Very good pulled pork. When I need a bbq fix and have time to walk to the atrium, this is my place. Mac-n-cheese and greens are good too. Never had a fried pickle till here and I understand the hype now. Damn good food, quantity and price for airport food. Better than all the other typical fast food joints CLT airport offers.

exdTs9emYlDHV04fqE5edQ.text: Hey folks,  Keep in mind that you're grabbing a meal in an airport! How many other airport food court stalls do you think get rated on Yelp?? There's a reason there are a good number of comments about this place - if you have to travel and get hungry between flights I can't think of any other place I'd rather grab a quick meal! My annual pilgrimage to Alabama from MD takes me through CLT. As soon as I get off the plane I head straight for Brookwood Farms. There's NO good BBQ in Baltimore, so this is my first chance to get a taste before I get to Montgomery (and have more).   For airport food it's pretty good. It's definitely better than any restaurant BBQ in Baltimore. But, it's not fine dining - it's airport fare. To be honest, I always get the same thing, so can only comment on the pulled pork. I get it 'Bama style, so have them add cole slaw to the sandwich. A side of fried pickle and I'm good for the next leg of my trip. I know I'm heading home once I've had one of their sandwiches. On my return trip I stop again since it's my last decent 'Q for awhile... Enjoy.

8lWGUIy2PezqSjcshKbjAQ.text: Had the pulled pork and brisket sandwiches. Was ok, but the hush puppies were over-cooked or maybe had sat under the heat lamp too long. The biggest problem is we both had digestive issues later.  Not good for a layover with a drive afterwards.  I wouldn't go here again for that reason.

DSUy1KUoVHG9K3dqM-LfGQ.text: Surprisingly better than I expected! The brisket was very flavorful and moist. The ribs were ok. I wouldn't recommend it. It's a bit tougher so you must must use your hands and get dirty eating it. The Mac and cheese was creamy. The food were not hot but didn't expect it to. It's quite expensive but very filling!

7qnC69n_2V8MVUHKvqO_LA.text: On a mission to try something "local" at the airport, we stopped at Brookwood Farms BBQ. It LOOKED great... Fried okra, fried pickle, pork BBQ sandwich, Mac & cheese, sweet tea, cole slaw.   Alas, the meat was dry, and it didn't help that they were stingy on the sauce.  The mac & cheese was good, though, and I really liked the greens. (Though they were bland... I think that's why I liked them. Wuss.)

_pAx-piFDxaCfxoQWgQxGg.text: OMG, this restaurant is what BBQ is all about!!!! The chicken is nice and tender, customer service is awesome , the sauce is Whew Jesus good.  Since moving down south this was the top rated BBQ ever. Wish there were more restaurants and especially one in Atlanta. You must eat the fried pickles those just take your BBQ meal to the top.

TWdukjZvz9v4Aa_MeYRdSA.text: This was actually decent BBQ for an airport. Pulled pork wasn't the best but it was decent. Corn bread was good. The brisket looked really good.

trn043pAEteu0N7Xz3ncow.text: Landed here this afternoon and not renting a car. Hotel I am at has nothing within walk so had to eat at the airport before I grab the shuttle. Not a bad place, brisket was on the tough side but good flavor and nice portion at fair price. It is the airport! mac n cheese pretty good, beans were good as was the cornbread. Fried pickle good too. Pork sandwich the guy in front of me got was huge. The staff here is VERY pleasant, as are 99% of workers down here. Wish that could be transplanted up north NJ where I am.

pTRpGGtxwL6T1VBaxmOJZw.text: When it comes to barbecue, and specifically brisket, this is one of the best ones I have had, and not just at an airport, but everywhere. Their brisket is dry rub, and they give you a side of vinegar based sauce. The option of signs are also well-made and tasty. For example, the collard greens are not sweet. They also have one of the best pecan pies I have ever had. The prices are also right, more so for an airport. It is a cafeteria style restaurant, where you stand in line, choose your items, pay, and go sit down to eat them.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pecan pie

BmHaOzMawwkMOr0BJNYkYQ.text: Really good for food from an airport. Brisket was lean and tender. It went well with the collard greens and fried pickle. Mac and cheese was so-so.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket platter with Mac and cheese, collard greens, and corn bread

q56UwT00li8iabZMQfbZEw.text: Thought I'd give this place a chance even though it's in an airport...afterall, it is still NC.  However, it was very disappointing!  Ordered the 2 meat option but was told they were out of ribs, so I went with pulled pork & brisket. I should have told the guy nevermind when I saw him draining the grease from the pork (meat ended up being mushy).  At least the brisket was decent, still not anything to write home about.  Fried okra was not good & the corn lacked any flavor (how hard is it to add some butter?!).  Go spend your money elsewhere & pray that it works out for your CLT airport dining.

8dXhmAZyNmDUHIT34ci1_Q.text: Not a bad place and dish is not too costly for an in-terminal bbq pit. Next to chick fil a. During peak hour, you might wait 15-20mins in queue and might be hard to find a table to seat. The brisket taste tender and the sauce is not too sweet to me. The greens and coleslaws are fresh looking and taste. I would come back to this spot anyway. Cannot find a con for this place so 5/5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket Platter

gjWDmucXuWLc_5w0Yt72PA.text: I'm going to call BS that you did not have regular dressing and only carry fat free. Other than that the salad was fresh and portions generous.

V0o6cpduKi67luvxyBmcGw.text: I've had some shitty BBQ food in my life.  I've survived drunk relatives cooking over charcoal grills. I didn't expect much, BBQ in an airport. But this... this set a new low bar. This was like setting $30 on fire. Because taking a few bites we ended up throwing it all away and waiting in line at Chic-fil-a next door and getting something we could eat. And I HATE Chic-Fil-A for all they stand for, so if I'm lowing my own moral bar down to that level then you know this BBQ was just terrible.  The brisket was nasty. Fatty, gross, awful. The mac n cheese was probably the most edible thing but still just gross.  The pulled pork... if that was in fact pulled pork... was without a doubt the worst I have had.  I'm sorry I tried this place. save your money.

uJ_HNSinGpBjLckPuJZR6Q.text: Delicious food: bbq briskets (a bit salty but good if you like saltier foods),fried cucumbers, fried okras and hush puppies. The cornbread was nice and soft. Pulled pork was good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States

ZUVhLae-w5F1vVdHvgZoAg.text: I've been here both for dinner and breakfast. I like that it's not chain fast food like the surrounding stands.   The barbecue plate I've had for dinner was not bad for airport food. It's about having the right expectations for food options at the airport. The meat was well flavored and didn't seem like it had been sitting under a lamp for too long.   For breakfast, they have plates that include scrambled eggs, bacon or sausage, biscuit, oatmeal or grits. Around $10, so it's definitely fair.

wQ5EK07MDZuzjuYW6WhWQw.text: I got the BBQ plate with brisket, corn, and green beans. Mixed feelings.   Pros: great beer selection, good corn bread, and they serve all dishes with a fried spicy pickle... SO good.   Meh: corn and beans were corn and beans. They weren't bad, but they weren't great either.   Cons: there's no butter butter, only vegetable spread. I took a bite of the brisket, tried to bite it off and I couldn't. I ended up putting the whole strip in my mouth, chewed on it for over a minute and had to spit it out. It would not break down. The sandwiches looked good, but I'd 100% pass on the brisket.   Overall it was an OK meal. Not amazing but not bad. It's not worth $15, but at the same time it is airport prices.

s-illVHmVJk0zypqK3gcsw.text: The President was hanging around Charlotte so we opted to skip snacks in town make sure we got here (lost two hours going through Hot Springs in the 90's, presidential motorcade=cluster something) Got through security and wandered over to the main food fest where BBQ lingered in the air. MLB and I split a three-meat platter: brisket that was hot and moist and tender and just a little too fatty on one end; thick sliced fork tender turkey that still had some substance; and a pair of tender good chicken thighs with the skin still on... Masheds on the side were potatoey with a little mouth feel and bits of peel for the eye, green beans were a little soft but a long way from mush. yea beans! Cornbread was firm and corny, breaded pickle spear was an unexpected treat! tart and zippy with dry firm crust. A little spendy but still a good option if you're looking to combine trips. Me, I look at it like a delivery charge...

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. 3 meats: brisket, turkey slabs, chicken thighs plus green beans and mashed, corned bread (the square one) and pickled bread (the long one)

P6Cn1paMhRn6thiEtFEsPw.text: Had a layover in Charlotte and needed a bite.  I looked at the usual quick food suspects, but wanted something a little more.  Picked Brookwood Farms after reading a few reviews.  I got the Dirty South MAC n' Cheese with pulled pork.  The pulled pork was moist, and the sauce had a nice zing to it as Carolina sauce should.  The Mac n' Cheese was creamy and truth be told I live mac and bbq, so I was in hog heaven.  It also came with a piece of corn bread.  The corn bread was nice, not too sweet.  Overall a nice stop in a busy airport.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States

TeM4uUmil5_KwyrwBzIPUw.text: This is one of the best airport food, southern bbq, tasty melt in your mouth good portion the price is right, corn bread was delicious and i put some honey on it food is life. Every bite was a carnival of flavour. Brisket was well smoked.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States

C4hFdbLEpgVij6lBo9VHpg.text: Nestled between Concourse C, D, and E next door to Chick-fil-A is this very appetizing Cafeteria style (with the brown trays to boot) Barbecue restaurant in the heart of Charlotte, NC Airport (CLT).  Their Pulled pork Is very tender, and delicious with just a slight hint of black pepper.  The sauce is not to sweet and not too tart.  The baked beans are tangy and sweet,  the collard greens are not too shabby either.  Now, the yellow cornbread is absolutely scrumptious.  Very good place to stop and eat on a long layover.  They have free refills on your Fresh sweet tea and lemonade and offer military discount.  Plenty to eat and don't forget to leave room for the sweet potato pie for desert( little low on the cinnamon, but very good).

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States

ufWdkHkLq5Tj31jHjLbM7Q.text: Tasty sausage and good sauce. Mushy green beans, but I guess that's how they're supposed to be at a southern BBQ joint. Good creamy coleslaw. Decent unsweet iced tea. Hard to find a table in the shared food court area, but sharing is caring.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sausage platter with green beans and coleslaw
Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States

yLZNO3nAh0xnpSStLTuZWg.text: I had the rice bowl with pulled pork. Came with collard greens, a fried pickle, and cornbread. I also got a bottle of water, and my husband insisted I try sweet potato pie since I've never had it before. All of that came to $22, so I guess par for the course for eating in an airport. If my husband was eating too it would have been over a $40 meal for lunch for the two of us, which really is a lot. The food was honestly better than I expected and I cleaned my plate! And then I tried the pie. I had no baseline expectations since I was a first timer, but I am pretty sure my life will never be the same. How I have lived 33 years on this earth and never had it before I will never know, but I looked up a store that sells it in my hometown (Walmart does lol) and now I'll be stopping there on my way home. I'm so glad I came here for lunch instead of the usual Burger King etc. This was more expensive, but way better!

a4v8tDkoAw_GP8mIsLjTMQ.text: Mediocre bbq but still decent for an airport.   Brisket (2/5) - was moist but I definitely didn't think this stands up to average Texas brisket  Hot links (3/5) - tasty  This will fill you up but don't get your expectations up

-ZkKz69FiEWzWMq-LjnQTA.text: Pretty good BBQ. I stopped in at the Brookwood Farm eatery at the Charlotte airport between flights. It was good, pretty good. I had the meat plate. The pulled pork was good, mildly smoky, a little too vinegary. The chicken thighs were better, nice skin and BBQ sauce.  The fried okra was ok but not hot.  The corn was ok.   The cornbread was fair.  Over all a decent place to eat at the airport.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States

B3qUUNkuza6U6ELKpVYRTg.text: $7.49 - yes 7.49 - for a stored, far less than fresh, biscuit. No sides. No anything. $7.49. (And the small drink is $3.50.) Or you can get a Charlotte classic, Bojangle's, 300 feet away for $3-4 a biscuit.

_znsmuxJeS2M3Kcj5DaUNg.text: Was connecting my flight through charlotte...  smelled this place on my walk by... immediately turned right and headed to their line... got a brisket plate with greens, mac n cheese, cornbread, and a hush puppy... I will definitely remember this place on my way through. That sauce though... for a airport bbq place, I love it!  The lines is long but fast... and the people are cool to talk to.

_d0tDAVTxm6vZD4DG_40UA.text: The brisket is probably the best option here if you are craving for bbq. I wanted to try a few different meat so I got the 3 meat plate with brisket chicken and pulled pork. The brisket is by far the best and I'd probably just do the brisket sandwich next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. 3 meat combo with Brisket, Chicken, pulled pork with rice and mac.

IB6YxsTFuZiQ2UV96eL15w.text: Food, at least the brisket and mac and cheese was very good. But here's the thing: when you're in an airport, you would think they would give a minute's thought to how to do takeaway. Round plates with flimsy tops in a regular plastic bag does not get food from restaurant to gate in one piece. They need some square cardboard boxes, flat bottom bags, and need to put in a wet wipe (because this is BBQ, for G%d's sake). They would end up with more satisfied customers that way.

BJONJrs0Di73DXLP1iNFjA.text: Slop pork.  Ordered the Carolina bbq sandwich--which on the menu describes the typical spicy vinegar sauce. She put the sweet sauce all over without asking and the slaw on the side without asking.  Had to add the spicy vinegar at register. Ended up paying for a sloppy sweet mess. Meat itself not very memorable. Very oven mush. If you want good bbq get it elsewhere. Sandwich 10.50 with tax.

XjpDgEMNKNIFvcBEVk9FqQ.text: This is probably my favorite airport food in the U.S.   I have sampled several BBQ items over the years (most recently the brisket) and have never been disappointed.   It is worth a layover in CLT to be able to visit this place. Prices are a bit high, but not so crazy for an airport.   Bless these folks. You're doing yourself a favor if you eat here before boarding.

1fe_PDnHXJbIDlRHXXdHFw.text: Missed my connecting flight at Charlotte to Alabama for work which meant that I was stranded in the airport for 4 extra hours. Irritated, I patrolled up and down the food court area looking for something to calme me down. As I walk on out, the smell of bbq wafts over.  Ordered the chicken and ribs combo with mashed potatoes and cornbread..though i'm still curious about the brisket....  In any case, the ribs were a bit dry but they fell off the bone and the bbq sauce helped. the flavor-- I couldn't tell for sure, but It seemed like a liquid smoke flavor rather than genuine wood coal, bbq. The chicken was tender and moist which disappeared to mear bones in no time.  All in all, not the best bbq I've had, but it is definitely worth hitting up when you're stranded in layover hell.

0upBIwdAyFcBhYuRnWYsYA.text: A little pricey, but good food. It has a nice spread of tables in front so one can enjoy the meal while waiting for a connection. Had the brisket sand & mashed potatos

r6MiUWGGyH3loLTP5VeK1g.text: If are on a quest for the best BBQ on the planet and have come to North Carolina, good move. (Texas can bite me.)  If you decided to head to an airport on your quest, not so good move.  If, on the other hand, you find yourself in the CLT food court for some other reason -- like, say, you are waiting for a flight and got hungry -- then congratulations, you have discovered the promised land.  I have had a lot of food at a lot of airports, and this is hands down the best anywhere. Except maybe that wine bar at MSP.  Order the pulled pork; do not bother with anything else. They will ask if you want sauce. Even though you are in North Carolina, they actually mean some sickly sweet sticky slime because most of America has had its mind corrupted. (Did I mention Texas can bite me?) The correct answer to their question is: "No, thank you; where is the vinegar based sauce?" The answer to that is usually "next to the cash register" but sometimes it wanders off.  Sides? Baked beans and collard greens, of course.  You're welcome.

lgr_LUK73c4UpXGI-Cec1g.text: The food is horrible!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! It's dry and you can tell it's been sitting out for hours. I work at the airport and tried this for lunch got the ribs and chicken combo. Ribs were dry with no sauce chicken was dry and Mac& cheese straight out the box! The fried pickle was delicious that's the only reason it gets on star! Girl at the register did not give me or the guy in front of me bags or lids we had to keep asking. Won't be back for the ribs or chicken that's for sure.

bxkxhp0_F43SL_PR9grb3Q.text: I just ate their BBQ chicken with greens, corn bread, fried pickle and rice. The BBQ chicken and BBQ sauce were delicious. The greens were perfect. The rice and corn bread were just OK. My boyfriend's briscuit was tender and also very good. Prices were decent at about $9 to $11 for a full meal that left us both full. This is a good place to stop on a layover. It is quick and the food court like set up is clean.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ chicken dinner with greens and rice
Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States

F5iwGkC2jpZ9cciOeru9uA.text: Another day in Charlotte Airport and another visit to Brookwood Farms BBQ.   Seriously, if Charlotte was my hub, this would be my daily meal.  Love, love love the pork sandwich with coleslaw.  Skip the "fast" food at the airport and enjoy the bbq here - great service and great food.

dShLXxWHfQRvGCJKNoI22A.text: Not bad for an airport and a good choice if you're passing through and want a solid meal and a True taste of the Carolinas. I opted for the turkey on this day so I can't speak for the pork or brisket, but they looked good. The collard greens were fine and the Mac 'n Cheese was fantastic. The hush puppies weren't great, but the fried pickle was a nice surprise. The ladies behind the counter keep the line moving. Tip: Pass on the BBQ sauce that the ladies offer behind the counter and use the vinegar-based sauce down by the cash register. Drench your meat and collards in it!

APrvfIoTDfdDF2C-DJRSPA.text: Not too bad for airport food.  The ribs were tasty and moist, and the collared greens were good, too.  Wasn't big on the mac and cheese.  Next time I'm in the Charlotte airport, I'll likely come back here.

R3Y7G8ZSq2-yRdW9PjRp-w.text: It was ok- honestly I thought after reading reviews it would be better for almost 18 bucks for a pulled pork platter and a smart water. The pork was moist and flavorful with the bbq sauce. I got hush puppies that I tried for the first time and they throw in a fried pickle and cornbread.

vTS5CXQtDTgm_M2RN3zeeg.text: Decent BBQ in an airport? Are you kidding me? Yet that's just what you get with this spot in the event you have a bit of a layover in Charlotte. Nice selection of traditional BBQ meats with a good number of very good sides, all of surprising quality given the fast food mentality necessitated by the location. I had some of the best brisket I've had in a long time, easy to separate with nothing but the cheap plastic fork you get in an airport. A surprising and welcome alternative to the usual airport fare.

WpfW6THY-LnRVTLEEZzX9A.text: Got stuck in the airport on a delayed flight, and my ticketing agent recommended coming here when I asked the best place to eat in the terminal. I wasn't disappointed. I got the turkey, because frankly, I'm too lazy to make a turkey at home, and it was surprisingly moist. BBQ sauce was a tad bit thinner than I was expecting, but a nice heat without being overbearing. Mac and cheese was kind of standard fast food (think frozen meal flavor), but the red skinned mashed potatoes were a lot better than I was expecting. My corn bread was moist- definitely not expected. Hello, fried pickle- I love you. Staff was quick but courteous. Would return, though hopefully next time not for a six hour flight delay.

JzONm3t4fxBM9OE0eJUvGA.text: Great choice in this airport for a solid plate! I got a platter of food that no joke lasted me 2.5 meals and made the people on my flight home jealous as hell. I didn't really slather my meat with the BBQ sauce because it was delicious on its own. I made the point of getting the greens to balance the guilt of the meat mount and I wish I had more because they were surprisingly not bitter. This place is a must especially compared to overpriced airline box food.

tpyeLdH2WVHtwIOGSznonQ.text: Wellllll now... I say, I say Brookwood has some damn fine pit BBQ, with all the fixin's.  Y'all behind the counter sure do know southern hospitality.  I was holed-up at my gate for some time and got a reeeal hankerin' for what y'all do best... BBQ.  Don't get me wrong, now... all those fast food "BBQ" chains are good.  But during my recent trip, I didn't take kindly to imitation BBQ and needed the real thing.   For all other weary-eyed travelers out there.  Make a stop at Brookwood.  You certainly won't regret it, you hear..??

WtMJdUShumeZZ5z9vDPVKg.text: It's a sin to call this BBQ. I've had better food and service from a vending machine.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States

oL3pVCwjFn9ndJpp9cxnDw.text: Every time I pass through CLT I see this place. It always looks packed. Definitely smells good. Today was the forest time i tried this place after walking pass this place over 5-6 times within the year. I got something plain and simple, brisket sandwich and one side(mac n cheese) and a fountain drink. 14 bucks. The brisket was good, moist/flavorful. The bun it came on, over toasted/hard/cold=yuck. The mac n cheese was eh. It is what it is, I didn't expect much it is airport food. Next time I'll ask for a new fresh bun when I'm in line.

xKUpNXd7g2Tmt9jd8G1GZQ.text: I'm skeptical of anything in the airport but read an article about this place and am delighted we stopped.  Delicious brisket with awesome bark and nice sauce.  Fresh, moist cornbread with just-picked corn flavor.  My son ate the mac and cheese before I could sample - he said it was great.  Reasonable price - about $12 for 4-5 oz meat, cup of mac, big hunk of corn bread and a fried okra or jalapeno - and did I mention this is in an airport, where you can pay $5 for a bag of chips!   We will be back.

Gniojs3SlrmUzvOGjlIRLQ.text: This is the best aiport BBQ I ever had!  Got ribs and chicken that was really flavorful and tender!  Definitely would come here again!  I was disappointed that the corn bread was dry but the fries were good!

n_NA1e0Zf1h1ZPrm0_AkNw.text: Pretty good tasting bbq. The line can get pretty long and the prices aren't cheap -- probably about $15-20 per person. However, the food taste fresh and it's filling. There's a small sprinkling of tables across the area. This restaurant is located in a long food court.   The sides are unique and there's a very good variety. I chose the collard greens and okra. Plate comes with a fried pickle and corn bread. Everything tasted great. The brisket is fatty, so you have been warned if you prefer lean and not moist.   There was easily enough food to keep you full. I didn't have to eat again until late dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket with fried pickle, collard greens, okra and corn bread.

WzP8O2Icm3LCx5_nYIwjXQ.text: There was a bit of a layover before my flight to Denver. I hadn't eaten anything but the pair of cookies they gave me on the airplane. As I quickly walked out of my gate into the terminal, I noticed a BBQ place.   I walked up to the restaurant and noticed the had quite a few choices on the menu. Because of the next flight, I wanted to keep it simple. I got pulled pork, with sweet bbq sauce, in creamy mac n' cheese.  It was a well-balanced meal. And by well-balanced I mean, I could get equal portions mac n cheese and pulled pork on each bite. The pork was juicy and melted in your mouth.   The cornbread was just ok. Unfortunately, It was nearly dry and wouldn't soak up the juices from the pulled pork and mac n' cheese without crumbling. Which was unfortunate because I LOVE cornbread  I don't eat pickles, but there was a fried pickle that came with the meal.   Next time I'm at this airport, I'm definitely coming back to Brookwood Farms to try the brisket!

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. In case you missed it
Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Simple Mac n cheese with pulled pork, corn bread and fried pickle

EOq1PVTmvwup4oHVLzraMQ.text: Quite possibly the best airport food I've had. My flight was delayed so I ended up wandering around... there was so many options but figured I'd give this bbq a try. I don't know that I'd agree with it being Carolina bbq... it's more Texas style, but whatevs.   They didn't have pulled chicken... so I ended up with the pulled pork. Which was good, the collard greens were good as well; the green beans... not so much. There's tons of options here (assuming they have it) I was interested in their bowl options too (maybe my next layover)  If you're in the airport and looking for a decent food option stop by... however it's not cheap and they don't offer to go containers... so I couldn't give them five stars because there's no real way to grab and go.

U-ODRpjlsCf1MMoHS4s4rg.text: Brookwood literally had one of the longest lines in the Atrium for food besides their neighbor.  Walking through the Atrium trying to figure out what to ea, you got a hint of BBQ as you walk by, walk closer and the smell get stronger, so much so that you have to go and see what is creating such a mouth watering aroma in the air!!!  The servings are huge so if you are hungry, you wont be once you finish this meal!!!  Not starving but still hungry, I went with a loaded baked potato which I found out you can actually get pulled chicken or pulled pork added, which would make a hefty tater, I took a meatless option with cheese, bacon and chives.  The potato was huge to say the least and hit the spot!    The kiddo went with the Chopped BBQ Chicken platter which gave you a choice of two sides, mashed potatoes and mac and cheese and a fluffy large slice of cornbread!!!  Cheesy and creamy mac and cheese, the mash was whipped just right and the cornbread was not dry and you knew it had some butter in it!!    They have a lot of sides to choose from too such as collard greens,  green beans, baked beans, veggie rice and fried okra, which is a rarity when you find it on a menu.    If you are debating on getting the pulled chicken sandwich with the one side and a fried pickle, it is what it is, they will not let you make any alterations to that combo.  They also have sweet potato and I was heartbroken to see that they had sold out of pecan pie.    Everyone who helped us from the nice lady who made put together our selections to the young lady who rang us up where helpful and efficient.  The understand that your time my be limited and did their best to get you on your way as quick as possible.    Extra kudos to the cashier who told me the beer I picked up was $10 before she rand it up and let me know that I could get a bigger water than the one I grabbed for a few cents more.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Drinks
Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sides
Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Loaded Potato

iRSwcEmNXX4NRFK2Y1IfuQ.text: BBQ in an airport, what could go wrong? Brookwood Farms can be sensed from many terminals away, in a sense almost leading you to it. You are in North Carolina, a layover to be specific, and one could experience some decent BBQ possibly?  I rarely come across decent airport food quite honestly, so I did not expect premium cuts of beef or pork with sides. I was really just hoping for a decent meal while waiting for my next flight. Long lines gave me some hope, but the cafeteria heated food left me questioning my decision, either way I went in for it. I grabbed the pulled pork multi platter option with some collard greens, cornbread, and fried okra. I do not think one can get more country than that. Puns aside the portions were quite plentiful and the pricing was what you would expect for an airport, very pricey. To the point, the pulled pork was pretty plain and the BBQ sauce was very sour, not my cup of tea. As for the sides, they were okay, and honestly did not have any complaints when it came to the okra, on point!  Would I re visit, probably not based on the lackluster meal I had here. There are plenty of other options in the airport that look much more appealing.

JpI0arb9LVqYlt-qDB5v1Q.text: Noticed airport staff and pilots in line so I figured this was the place to try. Had the Mac and cheese with brisket (called "dirty Mac n cheese"). Received a generous portion, and while the brisket was tender, it was really fatty. I was also hoping both the brisket and Mac and cheese had better flavor as this was just ok. Nothing spectacular but not horrible either.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Dirty Mac and cheese with brisket. Ate most of the brisket but left a lot of the Mac and cheese.

_mAIZCeIxhNG-1kAHnBshA.text: This is probably the best airport food here.  Is it the best BBQ?  Not quite BUT compared to the standard BK, McDonald's, Hudson News, and Manchu Wok at the airport, this is amazing.  And the prices and portions are very reasonable!  The 3 Meat BBQ platter is only $19 and includes 3 meats, 2 sides, and either hush puppies or cornbread.  Some highlights: 1. Smoked brisket: This is the MUST get - I actually got double for my platter.  It's flavorful, tender, and has that beautiful pink ring.  It's the moist version so not exactly lean but I have never gone for lean brisket - the fattier the better in my world! 2. Pulled pork: Solid although not as great as the brisket.  You can get the BBQ sauce on or on the side. 3. Mac & Cheese: Not bad but not great - a bit on the bland side. 4. Hush puppies: Decent but not that fantastic. It serves its purpose. 5. Cornbread:  Decent but slightly dry  Portions are pretty geenrous for the airport and a 3 meat platter can easily feed 2 - there was definitely at least a pound of meat!  Overall, a great option at CLT vs the standard airport fare.

gbEDGCYnaZuQezFXV-Vcbg.text: What happens when you have emotionless service, cold responses, and a lack of the food you have on your menu? You gave the Carolina BBQ at the Charlotte airport! I stopped here Monday night while on a layover between Sint Maarten and Buffalo. The line here was a decent size and every single person in line wanted the same thing I did, chicken. Come to find out they were out of every single form of chicken, so instead of being nice about it all the staff members just acted irritated that everyone wanted chicken and not BBQ Turkey. I'm not one to fuss so I took the BBQ Turkey with a side of macaroni and cheese, mashed potatoes, and some hush puppies and called it a day. Asking questions seemed painful to the employees and they even seemed annoyed when I asked what one of the unlabeled dishes were, makes sense right? Once I got my drink and paid, I at least thought this place could redeem themselves with some good food.......and then I took a bite. Guess what? The food wasn't good. It was a mixture of cold/Luke warm meat and cheese and hush puppies that were both rock hard and warm at the same time. The mashed potatoes tasted as bland as could be and when you also took into consideration that they were cold, well, they were bad also. The Turkey wasn't good, the macaroni and cheese wasn't good, and when you mix that with some real crappy service you get a total fail for a meal.  I would not recommend coming here, there are plenty of other options in this airport.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Even the photo looks bad.

MyHsL0zd0Qf_ukEUfnXHVQ.text: Yeah. I blame myself for eating here when there was a perfectly good Chick-Fil-A right next door. I saw the bad reviews, but their picture of biscuits and gravy tricked my starving body into wanting it.   I ordered the sausage biscuits and gravy with eggs and hash browns. The biscuits weren't fluffy, the gravy had an overwhelmingly over salted taste to it and the eggs were cold and flavorless. It is as if they cheapened them up with excessive amounts of water. The hash browns were decent, a little overly greasy but not too bad.   Definitely a meal I wish I could take back. Especially since this wasn't a cheap meal by any means.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Biscuits and Gravy with eggs and hashbrowns

esoqwY3omkfuz8j9YB532Q.text: I honestly think this is the best food you can find in an airport! Good value, the line goes by really quickly, and sometimes BBQ is just what you're craving in Charlotte. I go through Charlotte airport a lot for connecting flights and this has become my go-to spot for food. They offer BBQ platters that are enormous. The standard platter includes 1 meat, 2 sides, choice of cornbread or hush puppies, and a fried pickle. You can add another meat for an additional cost. I recommend the smoked brisket the most, although there is a good amount of fat on it, so beware if you don't like that. I like all the sides I've tried so far, including the fried okra, collard greens, mashed potatoes, baked beans, green beans, mac and cheese, cornbread, and hush puppies.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pecan pie ($5.99)
Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried okra sold as a single side ($2.99)
Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Smoked brisket platter with mashed potatoes, fried okra, cornbread, and a fried pickle

izAcDS6ma6KmEbPqMnDTPw.text: Thankful for BBQ in an airport, and admittedly my first BBQ in the Carolinas, nonetheless the meat flavor and consistency was perfect and the meal hit the spot. The Mac and cheese was underwhelming but the pulled pork sandwich was delectable , again given the airport circumstances, still a pleasant surprise. Felt that I got a brief glimpse, and taste, of NC BBQ and maybe one day I'll come back to this state for more

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States

F16ViWqNCWhIOpRHqI70dg.text: When your flight leaves in 10 but god damn you gotta' have that Q!  If you're expecting world class BBQ in an airport... well than you're expecting world class BBQ in an airport...  The pulled pork sandwich and lonely singleton fried pickle is a fine filler while you wait for your delayed American Airlines flight. Don't forget the slice of Sweet Potato Pie to-go that will inevitably get murdered during takeoff in the overhead compartment.

vZUbpt5JEyZiXQtPVZ-m1g.text: Picture yourself exhausted from 10hrs on a plane and hit with more flight delays. What do you choose? I chose bbq as my first me back in the US after a trip overseas. I'm a Midwesterner at heart--which means that I have a different set of standards for how bbq and sauce should be allocated. Those standards aside, the pulled pork sandwich was tangy (a bit of peppery kick!); the accompanying fried pickle was surprisingly good. Friendly and fast service. It's local...And certainly better than neighboring chicken-based fast food franchise alternatives!

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork sandwich

O8r_ZdXQVq5pgKgApBa2oQ.text: Maybe the negative reviewers forget: this is airport food! Compared with most other airport food, this is marvelous. Regional, tasty, fair price, good service. What more do y'all expect at an airport restaurant? Just quit fussing over minor details and get your Daniel over to this place next time you at CLT.

f09mvv7j4nVHUdwFDmrung.text: Looked at reviews across the airport and tried to go with the best option available with the best reviews. This was that place. Traveling airport to airport I have come to the understanding that airport food is very underwhelming. The food at airports is never as good as food outside of the airport. That being said I expected at least something decent. I have had better pulled pork at a cafeteria. The hush puppies, mashed potatoes, and baked beans were alright at best. Would have rather gone to Chick-fil-A next door for the almost $20 paid.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork platter

ZyJ38vLpfEchDTVv43vptQ.text: I was disappointed that the first employee who you give your order to seemed annoyed by me asking questions. I don't see why me asking how many sides, and how much an additional side was would be such an issues. She was totally rude to not only me but the customers directly behind me. That's pretty bad because the food was actually good. I had a pulled chicken bbq sandwich, macaroni, and a fried pickle. I only wish my experience was more pleasant.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Register
Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Line
Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled barbecue chicken sandwich, macaroni, and fried pickle

qBxGGmOu1ZoODU8_AejKEw.text: I was pleasantly surprised to find really good bbq at the airport. After security we were looking for a place to get food quickly, didn't want to eat at any of the chain restaurants, and decided to try this place. This place seems to be extremely popular, there weren't many people in line when we got there, but the line built up behind us pretty quickly.   We got a meat platter with chicken thighs, mashed potato, corn, and cornbread and a rice bowl with pulled pork and collard greens.   Chicken thighs were absolutely amazing, the sauce that came with it delicious. The sauce tasted great with the cornbread too. Pulled pork and rice was an amazing combo, collard greens were the only item I didn't enjoy, but then I don't like collard greens.   If you are traveling through the Charlotte airport, this is the place to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Rice bowl with pulled pork
Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Meat platter with chicken thighs

_BKfwicbCOc_Ntv_JX_aGQ.text: I thought I reviewed this joint years a go. It's decent bbq. The sides are pretty bad. I got the smoked turkey. Was dry and the sauce helped. The greens were good. The Mac n cheese is awful; horrible texture and no flavor. The hush puppies (odd) were good and the fried pickle was the best thing I had. Meat is too salty and overpriced.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Turkey platter

rq6u-3m3N_zToFurFjRUrw.text: Price is fair for the portions, but not the most friendly staff.  Pulled pork was great, fried pickle great, green beans ok.

8Py7h-F4J_KTGT36YBPzvQ.text: Tasty food, pleasant staff.  A little expensive compared to other choices nearby. Smoked brisket was 50% fat.

PdpQKFMiEdnYfYnGfQBaPg.text: I don't claim to be a BBQ connoisseur, but I do travel a fair amount and eat my fair share of airport food, so I do know to have lowered expectations. I wasn't expecting to be blown away, but was swayed by all these other reviews. I'd say it was mediocre, slightly overpriced, but edible. I ate here once, and it was the first (and probably the last) time I will eat here. Next time I will go to Papa John's or grab a burrito.  The chicken was burnt see my picture of the chicken camouflaged against the black plate) It was more or less edible though, it wasn't much tastier than getting rotisserie chicken from Costco and throwing BBQ sauce on it.  The mashed potatoes and mac & cheese were okay - edible, but didn't leave me craving more.  Just okay, wouldn't come back here again. I think Salt Lick in the Austin airport has better BBQ food. Maybe I came on an off-night but I think I'll stick to other choices next time.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken platter with mashed potatoes and mac &amp; cheese. Note the chicken is camouflaged with the black plate.

qV0jUhmMN7tIKe3uhmMFLg.text: If you find yourself in the Charlotte airport, eat here! I visited twice and got ribs and a pulled pork sandwich. The fried pickles are AMAZING! Seriously, try one!  Very reasonably priced and absolutely delicious. A meal here will leave you feeling full and content.  Highly, highly recommended.

UiAcAmrf0P0Sz3p3u6-U3Q.text: I wanted to love this place so bad. Everything looked so good and I thought for sure it would've been an instant hit. The vinegar based bbq over powers everything. It's too much. I've had other BBQ pulled porks and beef brisket it wasn't as strong as what I tasted. Server was fast. I didn't like the fact I had to help an older woman because the server didn't understand what she wanted to eat. Once I gave her my advice she then ordered. But, after she walked away the server started to make fun of the older woman. That wasn't very nice. The puppies were spot on along with the beans. Fried pickle was good too. I had to leave 1/4 pound of the 1 pound plate behind because I could not finish. Overall, with service, food prep, and some pretty good side dishes. 3 Stars at best. I did want to do more but I couldn't enjoy the meats.

UYHBdjrzzopy7wguyddCww.text: It's a good option when you're not in the mood to eat at one of the national fast food chains offered at the airport. The bbq won't blow your mind away but it will do its job decently. The employees seemed irritable and weren't helpful. I recommend getting the junior plate if you have a small appetite. It comes with 1 meat, 1 side, and corn bread. I got the beef brisket, which was thick cut. I got a piece w some fat in it, so I was pretty happy. There are a variety of standard bbq sides to pick from. I chose the collards. They were good.

mLKH585cp9_FWXlFOSF_pA.text: Better than I sharp stick in the eye. Cornbread was good. Tall black chick serving has an attitude. Other girls were ok

pP5v4xAgA17Jhgz4SVJv7g.text: You know the food here is good when I was not even upset about having an indirect flight because it gives us an hour layover over dinner time in the Charlotte airport. The food was that good when we were here last. This was some of the best BBQ we've had. The brisket was just awesome. Mac n cheese leaves something to be desired, but the meat was just fantastic. Believe it or not..can't wait for our next layover in Charlotte!!!

22d6J3PzcjfgJK38Aa6OTg.text: Other than the atmosphere not being great, this was great bbq, especially for airport food.

aEkrFCg2NZZ4Rgw9nLX0og.text: Your basic Carolina BBQ.  Very good, fast, generous portions. Not disappointing.  Would have been 5 stars if cashier had some personality or made eye contact or didn't seem so inconvenienced.

c1zdu8gT-ED2ntgQQ3EknQ.text: This place needs to invest in some serious customer service training. Just witnessed the white foreign lady in front of me get accosted by two servers when simply asking for them to check and see if there was coleslaw in the back. As another white b1tch looking to get some BBQ that treatment was uncalled for.

qcJKGk2JN8a5HgbH06gjpA.text: When you're hungry, in an airport, and craving BBQ - Brookwood is not a bad option. It's definitely not the best BBQ I've ever had, but I can say that it's not the worst. Had the brisket sandwich, coleslaw, jalapeno poppers, and a slice of pecan pie. The brisket sandwich had a healthy portion of meat and was tender. The bun left much to be desired. The coleslaw had a good flavor and the cabbage was still crunchy. Stay away from the poppers and pecan pie. Poppers were gross and the pie tasted stale and store bought.

KH0w7QLifLa2ddAgmH6XpQ.text: If work is paying again, I definitely would come back to this place. For $12, I had a bottled water and the chicken dinner with mashed potatoes (they use red potatoes), collard greens, and hush puppies. Interestingly, there were a couple of fried pickles with the hush puppies.  The chicken was surprisingly good, but the mashed potatoes could have used more butter so they weren't so gloopy. The collard greens were okay, but they could have used more of the meat broth to add flavor. The hush puppies were below average, but what else can you expect in an airport?

5RARAMwiEqko3OX-B9meDg.text: I like both the meat plate and BBQ pork sandwich.  It's my favorite place in CLT to grab a bite.  The collar greens and Mac & cheese make great sides.  All the plates come with a fried pickle.  The service and food quality are consistent.  It's also quick if you have a close connecting flight.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. BBQ pork with Mac &amp; cheese

a8FAaFVcjf_IxyrFhMjUvw.text: Yeah I know I'm in North Carolina but the beef was getting cut right off the brisket so I had to go for it.  I wish I would've had the pulled pork instead.  While the flavor was nice, it was a little too dry.    The coleslaw was ok but the fried pickle was excellent.  Definitely worth stopping for a beer and the fried pickles.  Plus, where you gonna get a $4 beer in an airport?

4o3uE_i7mzDRJWMUHzHzaA.text: A good choice when in CLT. For an airport restaurant, they are actually a pretty good value and it's nice to have some local flavor. BBQ chopped chicken, baked beans and green beans were all steaming hot. Sauce was a little sweet for my taste.

U_sjREUuHMEb2RKXV834BA.text: There does not appear to be a moist piece of meat in the house. My baby back ribs were too tough and dry for a place that claims to specialize in barbeque.  Sides are almost the only redeeming quality if this place. Mashed potatoes with turkey cream gravy and turnip greens were just what I expected.  If I am in the Charlotte airport again, I would stop by for a vegetable plate.  (Vegetarians beware-- most of their veggies seem to have meat products).  The deserts were solid-- get the pecan pie. You will close your eyes and swear that you stopped at Grandma's house on Thanksgiving.  Service was about what I'd expect at an airport-- prompt but not spectacular.  In all, worth the stop-- if you skip their barbeque.

MC6deYg5p1_q69pHb1O0VQ.text: You all let me down. I do not have high BBQ standards, but there was nothing special at all about this place. I had the pulled pork sandwich. It was fine. I had the mac and cheese. It was above average as a fast food side dish. They gave me a fried pickle. That was fun.  This is a place in the airport where you can eat food. The people were very friendly, which I appreciate - but I'm not sure if Brookwood deserves special recognition for that or it just so happens that everyone in Charlotte is pretty darn nice.

81D1UGPUinG6tcqGMp5lCA.text: Food is good. However watch the person cutting up the meat. They weigh it and I saw her deliberately pick out hunks of fat to add to plate to get it to correct weight. And don't you dare ask her to remove the fat she gets angry and acts like you asked her to spit out gold coins!!  I fly through Charlotte airport just about every week but they have lost one customer because of the way I was treated.  And I will make it my mission to tell others

UMfhuFzlWFeb3bqT90nIqw.text: Eh...I mean you're in an airport you can't expect it to be amazing. Got the brisket...was tender but the sauce is too sweet, just not my fave. Wasn't horrible but dear lord it was SO EXPENSIVE! $18 for brisket platter and a water. I should have gone somewhere else for that money. If they drop the price it may move up a star just because for this much you'd expect the best. Unless you are really craving BBQ or don't mind spending so much on mediocre food then this isn't for you.

_hsrQf0SIb8XdtoPHMlphw.text: Not great BBQ.  Had the turkey, it was dry and lacked flavor.  The fries were also bad.  The cornbread and green beans were good.  Overall not impressed but it would do in a pinch.

lIJdXQME04PY7QQyhs5yXg.text: Our morning layover in The Queen City led us straight to Brookwood Farms BBQ, which was serving up breakfast at the time of our visit. Two breakfast sammies and a couple OJs came to around ten bucks, which was pretty reasonable for the airport. The food court-style seating area nearby was clean, the sandwiches were tasty (bacon, egg, cheese and a hashbrown on a biscuit), and with that we were on our way.

dGSQTSGO9_bCMrliw28T3Q.text: Brookwood Farms was a decent dining option, compared to typical airport and chain fast food offerings.  I chose the 2-meat plate with brisket and pulled pork, as well as two (2) sides and a fried pickle. The brisket and pulled pork were slightly dry, but tasted much better than I expected for airport BBQ. The brisket was not pre-sliced and languishing in a hot plate, but cut fresh off a big hunk of meat. I wished there had been more sauce options (or a sauce station), but the regular red BBQ sauce and a few dashes of vinegar livened up the flavors. I really appreciated that the food was hot, as I feared the cafeteria style serving station would lead to lukewarm BBQ travesty.   Service was efficient and bare-minimum friendly. BBQ tends to be a more expensive dining option wherever you go, the Charlotte airport included. However, I think Brookwood Farms BBQ does provide a good alternative to travelers sick of cliche offerings.

YgZ17o4BFpFyqX2KH4FuTQ.text: Typical airport food. Fried items not too crispy, mac and cheese pretty mushy. The pecan pie was soggy. The gentleman on the register couldn't find anything. Pretty disappointing.

jiwn0SNv01V2YEaUiidjMw.text: Airport food doesn't have to suck, and this spot in Charlotte is proof.  We had a short layover here and needed to grab a late dinner, so we headed this direction as soon as we got off the plane.  It's not the best barbecue I've ever had, but it's more than decent, and it's definitely one of the better meals I've had at an airport, and for a pretty reasonable price.  The pulled pork was a little saltier than I'd normally like, but the texture was great.  For sides, I had the macaroni and cheese and fried okra, and both were delicious.  My husband had the brisket, baked beans and mac and cheese and liked all of it.  The cornbread that comes with is tasty.  The fried "extra" turns out to be a fried pickle, and apparently it's delicious if you like pickles (but is an unpleasant surprise if you don't).  We also got a slice of sweet potato pie-- my first time trying it-- and really enjoyed.  I'm sure North Carolina has more to offer outside the airport, but if you're not leaving the terminal, this is a solid choice.

gylAm2KWUrQ48daAEV7wKw.text: Really didn't think there was anything special with the BBQ at this place - the popular noodles from the restaurant next door looked tastier. The food @ Brookwood was lukewarm and there just wasn't that much flavor considering that this is a "famous" airport eater. I got the pulled pork sandwich, which comes with 1 side (I chose the mashed potatoes from their recommendation), and it comes with a fried pickle.   The pulled pork was a bit on the dry side and didn't have much more flavor than its standard pork shoulder meatiness. The BBQ on it helped but they don't give you much. The bun was pretty standard - could've used some butter or could've benefitted from being toasted. The mashed potatoes were good considering there was no sauce, very creamy and well seasoned. The fried pickle was just a little weird. For a little over $10 it wasn't super expensive but it also probably wasn't worth it. Will try another place next time I come through Charlotte!

0eMvxq5JpyER4jgoFx-GaA.text: Nothing can compare to Lockhart Texas for BBQ, but holly cow is this good. Traveling often, I've had more than my share of airport food. Hands down the best of all airport restaurants.  The brisket, fried pickle spear and fried okra was outstanding. A must have if in the Charlotte airport.

kY_DyuF8BUqcBI6t_kt9cg.text: Decent option of the airport, I guess.  They have all kinds of bbq and sides here, so the selection is not a problem. I just though there was too much vinegar in the bbq. I know that this style of bbq is vinegar based, but I think my serving or the bbq from that day was "over vinegard". I know that is not a word. This is Yelp, not a vocabulary test.    The meat I got was pulled pork and brisket. The mac and cheese side was decent and the fried pickle was my favorite.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Lunch

kLvJlSJF3mnCznxguhJxAA.text: Loved the brisket and the sides. I got cornbread, green beans and the broccoli salad. The line was short and the service was fast and efficient.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brisket, cornbread, green beans and broccoli salad.

1Om2430-tGaOdIm_ff1LQQ.text: I used to fly through CLT all the time and was pleasantly reminded why I didn't mind spending a couple hours here on my travel days. The reason is this BBQ spot. Its quick because its done fast food style in the food court but the food is delicious. Probably the only place in here with a line because people literally search it out.  I get the same thing every time - pulled pork sandwich with mac n cheese and a fried pickle on the side (comes with it). The pork has tons of flavor before you even put sauce on it and their sauce adds that much more. It's not my favorite style of BBQ sauce but no complaints by any means.  I think the fried pickle is my favorite part. Every time I get fried pickles they are done as chips but this place throws in a battered pickle spear with your meal. I need to look for more places that do them like this.  If you're in an airport with terrible options this place is a savior.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork sandwich with Mac n cheese and a fried pickle spear.

giimoDYIsFZetv6F31KEzQ.text: Good barbecue with fixings, however, the prices were ridiculously outrageous! $5 for an unsweetened ice tea?! Give me a break!!! Another airport restaurant rooking hungry travelers!

vRFTpnbZQFrAx0Fgn8RCOg.text: Airport food is what it is, right?  You choose something that you hope tastes decent and won't bother your stomach on the flight.  If it tastes good, it's a bonus.  This place was a bonus.  In the middle of a food court-like area in the airport, they have brisket, chicken, pulled pork, and other familiar barbecue offerings.  I had the pulled pork with fried pickles and broccoli salad.  The pork was tender and tangy, a decent offering.   The broccoli salad and fried pickles?  I've had better.  Overall, a good option if you're in the airport, need a meal, and want something that tastes good.  Don't expect top-flight NC barbecue, though.

8g51GUz2vBza19Zf6UG5ng.text: OH my LORD... Have merci on my soul.  The veggie place is to DIE for! The black eye peas are,cooked perfectly with the rut amount of sweetness. The mac & cheese is just mouth-watering delicious, perfect amount of salt and softness. The hush puppies? Don't even get me started on the hush puppies! Everything here at the Brookwood Farms BBQ is made with a precise balance, EVERYTHING. I even ate a fried pickle for the first time in my life and maaan I'm LOVIN' it.  Seriously our next trip is out to the south were the food is good and the music is loud! ;) I highly doubt ill be able to eat Southern/Soul food in Cali now... I've been marked by the natives! ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Line at at BBQ joint!
Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Carolina Pit BBQ
Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Veggie Plate to die for! MuSt TrY!! ;)

0giRfHwaeLLz8_FurhWDeA.text: Missed connecting flight. Might as well enjoy a nice lunch at the Charlotte Douglas airport! For airport food it was pretty good but a bit salty. Maybe too much bbq sauce.

Qcua1dajCCn1dus3c7EeHw.text: Good food, let alone good bbq can be challenging to find in an airport. I've actually had better bbq at airports but this is an ok alternative to the usual chicken, burgers, etc. The brisket is right in front of you, so there's no excuse for complaining about fat. The brisket had good flavor and was reasonably tender. The sides were fogettable and the sauce was bland.

C6jtBYh88AfPTivkmXE7Sw.text: Above average BBQ! Pleasantly surprised, didn't expect much especially considering it's in an airport. Truth be told, in the realm of airport food, this place is a steal, priced like most BBQ joints, similar portions, if not bigger. $15 for the brisket platter with 2 sides and cornbread.  Bottom line, plate clean, belly full, pretty damn good for an airport BBQ joint.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bottom line, clean plate, full belly, and I consider my BBQ to be better than most restaurants

rCI7FGKldFWWbgcO-8_hMQ.text: For airport food, this has always been one of my fave places to hit up when traveling (when I was not sprinting through CLT because a sales rep dropped me off too late).  Pulled pork, green beans, amazing hush puppies, and cornbread. Boom. But ask for double plates. The food practically bends the flimsy paper plates!  Good stuff.

9yiRSvSXmO0MIhoRWx2xzA.text: I find myself in CLT about every 5 weeks or so. No matter what, I get the brisket. Sure-that's not NC BBQ-but for me, this is one of their strengths.  Usually I add on the mac and cheese and beans or else the fried okra.  Pro tip--you can a breakfast platter with brisket!  Solid-fast BBQ at fair prices for the airport.

0E9MZBe2JJzLCiXLQnowog.text: Surprisingly good and not just "for airport food."  I'm not suggesting it's worth a trip to the airport (or Charlotte).  However if you find yourself here and even slightly hungry then this is a great alternative to standard airport fare.

KI6rjEC_oBy15sdYWwWNww.text: Let me start by saying the bbq was so good I forgot to take a photo!  Over priced but what airport venue isn't?  Had the Brisket platter with mac and cheese, and collards,and a large slice of cornbread.  Brisket was tender enough my plastic knife went thru the brisket like butter. Not a fan of the greens however, they are clearly from frozen or can, lacking in seasoning.  Cornbread was slightly sweet and moist.  Quality was a pleasant surprise. Located in the main food court next to Cinnabon.

7pLxBmmKfZPNxVs_7nJERw.text: Great bbq for an airport location! Brisket and pork was delicious. Had a rough morning and they gave me and my husband extra hush puppies.

M8mTCGUY5OiBu-hnFw2aMQ.text: When traveling through the airport in Charlotte this is a good place to eat.  The bbq is fine and fast.  The places to eat can be a little messy by that is the crappy airport design.  Ask if the fried okra is fresh before you order it, you will thank me for that tip.

BuOhK2j7PiJM8nBWwrlwdQ.text: This is straight up the best airline food I've had in ages. This is some of the tastiest and most comforting food I've had in a while. P.S. Fried Pickles are hella good

5rWS-6k1WeAKBmicGam_vg.text: Very good brisket, fried okra and hush puppies. The greens were a little bitter but still really good. We also got a fried pickle I guess they use as a garnish which was a nice surprise.   The restaurant is very clean and the staff were really friendly and helpful.   I would have liked to try the dirty mac and cheese which was a bowl with cornbread, Mac n cheese and your choice of chopped meat on top. Next trip through I will get this and review it.   The sweet tea is dynamite!  Perfect amount of sweet.   Great prices even for an airport diner.

fvICjkO3wiij3FrNtogueA.text: I fly through CLT almost weekly and even though I am a vegetarian I stop my Carolina's because they have good vegetarian choices. I typically get the green beans, salad, and mashed potatoes. All dishes come with a fried pickle and either hush puppies or corn bread. Tonight (10/25 @ 5:45 pm) however, what guests got was a side of attitude. Being a vegetarian the last thing I want to see on my plate is meat so when I saw that there was a strip of meat on my plate I asked for another plate.  The server slung the plate in the trash and threw my food in the plate. She served my meal with out the extras so I asked about the hush puppies and pickle and without saying a word she scooped up the hush puppies (no pickle) and moved on to the next customer without a word.   My quandary is whether I go back even though I like the food.  I don't need the attitude this the 3 instead of 4 stars.

QX5xck3xCoAcT4n2x63Daw.text: The BBQ was ok. I like the vinegar based sauce, but the meat was lacking in yumminess. Those hushpuppies though! All my years with LJS and I thought I knew what a hushpuppy was. These have a slight bit of sweet to them and are delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States

eGg9MPfxYVDCZ6s6auERvw.text: Really good! I got the 2 meat platter, opting for the brisket (I'm a brisket girl!) & the pulled pork since ribs weren't on the menu.  Platter came with 2 sides, a fried pickle & cornbread.  I chose the mac & cheese and baked beans for sides.  Man-o-man, that pulled pork was amazing!  It happened to be the girl behind the counter's favorite item & I'm glad I went with it cuz it was sooo juicy & flavorful!  The brisket was good too, especially with the BBQ sauce they poured over it, but by itself, it was a little tough & dry.  But still excellent flavor.  Mac & cheese was the weakest link, due to the mac being overcooked and tasting soggy.  Cheese flavor wasn't anything special either, but that's to be expected at an airport dining establishment.  Baked beans were good, again nothing special.  I'd never tried fried pickle before, & that was tasty.  Although I should've eaten the whole thing right away, as the outside breading quickly became moist & soggy also.  Lastly, the cornbread was just mediocre.  Kinda dry & definitely needed butter.  I also purchased some Sweet Tea, as it was only appropriate.  Nice thing was FREE REFILLS!!!  All that came to a total of $20, which wasn't too horrible considering I was in an airport & ordered quite a bit of food.  I was itch'n for some BBQ & this certainly satisfied that craving.  All-in-all, I would definitely recommend trying this airport eatery out if ever found to be at the Charlotte airport!

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. 2 meat platter: brisket, pulled pork, Mac &amp; cheese, baked beans, fried pickle spear &amp; cornbread. Sweet tea too

of0ZJKJwLLIM4ty_VNptqg.text: Great BBQ food at an airport.  I boarded my plane a happy camper.  The brisket entree and sides were generous and delicious.  I don't always trust BBQ restaurants at airports.  However, this place is a MUST DINE if you're in the mood for some Carolina BBQ.

nCdOqRe2ydfGEBH2Zexc0w.text: Saw a long line and walked by....thought must be a reason it's a long line at 2 pm.  Went back and had chicken thigh platter with greens, cornbread and fried okra with a fried pickle spear.  Enjoyed the meal and will eat here when I travel through CLT and worth the price and wait

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Chicken thighs platter with 2 sides

KZmHXb1T8luuWu9eKkip9w.text: Memphis. St. Louis. Kansas City. Barbecue capitals of America. You should include Charlotte, as we know 'cue here in this town and don't y'all forget it. So when you're changing planes here our very fine Queen City airport, stop in the main atrium (between the B and C concourses) and get yourself a plate of barbecue.  Yep, there's a line. Yep, it's totally worth it.  I got the pulled pork sandwich, which comes with one side. Mac & cheese is it. And of course, a fried pickle spear. You Yankees who ain't never had a fried pickle? Try it, you might like it.  They'll offer to put barbecue sauce on the meat. Your answer here is "Yes, please."  At the register, grab one of those locally brewed beers that you probably won't find elsewhere. OMB ("Olde Mecklenburg Brewery") or NoDa or a Carolina Blonde from Carolina Brewery up in Mooresville. Maybe a little cup of banana pudding too.  And find a place to sit. In this instance, I don't recommend the rocking chairs as it's potentially messy food and you don't want to wear it.  Pick up your sandwich and dig in. If it's like mine, it's tender and juicy and tangy and delicious. Mmmmm... that's barbecue. Welcome to Charlotte. Enjoy your stay!

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Brookwood Farms in CLT
Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork BBQ at Brookwood in CLT

4FJ6c2cnMhoNyql3UO1EVw.text: Edible, but not great.  The meat was not hot (barely luke warm).  The bread was toasted, but not recently.  Quite disappointing.

WQSjQ1TYjUY3pJm5wEZ3sA.text: Every time I layover in CLT, I always stop in the food court in the main concourse to get me some pulled pork!!  The meat quality isn't top notch, but it still tastes damn good once you add some BBQ and slaw on top!! The slaw is yummy.  So is the corn, baked beans, and Mac n cheese!! I get an extra side for $1.  Kinda pricey here, but it's the airport, and this is the better food option in the food court!  Better tasting, not better for you!!!  Platters are around $12-$15, and pulled pork sammy was $9.  But what's nice is they don't charge extra for the slaw.  I love pulled pork BBQ & slaw! Yum.

OHpQtUu9PO8SrtUUXC417Q.text: Located in the B-terminal.  Probably one of the better choices in the airport.  If you're looking for relatively cheap food that will fill you up while waiting for your plane this is the perfect place.    My Carolina Classic BBQ Pork sandwich, mac n cheese, and fried pickle was less than $10.  Can't beat that in an airport

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pulled pork sandwich

yueXMioNGbWcAA5AwZQdFw.text: A very good meal. I have passed by this eatery many times and finally built up the courage to try the food. I had the brisket meal with collard greens and baked beans. I topped the meal off with a tasty sweet potato pie. The collard greens could use a bit more spice and the sweet potato pie could use a bit more cinnamon, but still made for a good meal. Excellent choice for a meal if you are in the Charlotte airport.

aY031d3cxiEF1KbAN6_muw.text: I was rolling through one concourse to another to be nearer to my departure gate with a two hour+ layover in CLT airport. I was happy to find a bbq place. I had the pulled pork plate. Comes with a generous scoop of pulled pork with a slathering of bbq sauce on top. With it, comes two sides. I  chose green beans and coleslaw. I could also have baked beans, sweet potato fries, hush puppies, mac & cheese, tomato cuke salad as sides. They give you a piece of honey corn bread (which was good but needs butter) and what I thought was a wedge fry. Surprise! It was a tasty fried pickle!  Portions were generous for the price. They have various soda, water and other beverages to include sweet tea. Free refills which is great. I went back and nabbed  a slice of their sweet potato pie. I could've have just as easily gone with pecan pie too, but I was being good. It was delicious.

gDF44y6XBWhIMoyUSmDb-A.text: Had the bbq chicken sandwich with fried okra. Okra was cool but crispy. BBQ sauce was a little sweet for my taste, but the chicken was fresh and flavorful and the bun was soft. I would say this is a solid option for airport food!

KMIJRhyf7T_p-RCNxn718Q.text: Passing through the airport and had a long layover. Was looking forward to eating here as previous experience had been good. Today was definitely not good. My wife and I ordered identical meals. Hickory smoked brisket platters with greens and okra.  Brisket was 60% fat. In fact one whole piece I got was almost 95% fat. I posted a picture in the photos. It was hard to actually get the meat free from the fat too. My wife thought I got the better part of the deal so you can imagine what hers was like.   The okra was burned. Greens were ok and the best part of the meal. That and my Bad Penny beer which was good but this place didn't brew it. I hope this was just a one off experience but I'm thinking I'm not going to probably give them another shot at my food dollar. This bad experience cost me about $38 and was barely worth $3.80.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. Platter of hickory smoked brisket. Way too much fat. This whole picture is fat leavings. Okra was burned too.

EAaX23u8lUKBpdPivryaTg.text: Why 4 stars? Because this is very solid for airport BBQ.     ---   ---   ---  When you're at an airport, standards are definitely lowered. I fly through Charlotte fairly often, and must definitely attest that the fare at the people-mover-capital-of-the-world is uninspiring. However, Brookwood is a drink of water in the middle of the desert.  It's a fast casual spot, in the midst of a giant food court that's centered amongst all of the terminals, so convenience is a 5 out of 5.   I went with pulled pork, brisket, hush puppies, a fried pickle, and mac-n-cheese. It also comes with corn bread. Clearly, I was counting calories during my visit.  All items were at least average or better. I don't like fried things, but ordered the hush puppies due to the feedback on Yelp. They were definitely better than I anticipated, especially considering that whole 'they live in an airport' thing I just mentioned. But I still probably would order for something not fried on my next visit. The pickle was definitely worth ordering again.   Charlotte is probably the city I've laid over in the most without ever actually visiting. Until then, this is the closest thing to authentic Carolina BBQ I've had. I have failed.

N0DRcSzju5UJi3yd1xf-3g.text: I've walked by Brookwood Farms at the Charlotte (and Raleigh) Airport probably a hundred times and never stopped. With three hours to kill this time, meanwhile, I finally caved it and was more than disappointed. A two-meat combo and a drink set me back $20 and most ended in the trash. This tasted like precooked BBQ and brings no value to anyone that's had real BBQ. There's no doubt good BBQ is tough to find in airports and you aren't going to find it here (you'll likely have to go to DFW or Austin to achieve that feat).   Why was it so bad? Let's start with the chopped chicken. I took one bite and threw the rest away. This surely couldn't have been chicken (photo attached). It was dry, almost like a dried out sloppy Joe, yet worse. The turkey was overcooked and dry as well. As for the sides the sweet potato fries were clearly frozen and from a bag although the corn wasn't bad and the sweet sauce that comes with it is fine.   If you eat at fast food places like McDonalds you'll think this is good BBQ, but if you've even been to places in Charlotte like Mac's, Jim N Nicks or Midwood avoid a bite here. This is even a grade lower than Sonny's BBQ Pit and makes Shane's Rib Shack look good.

photos.caption: Photo of Brookwood Farms Carolina Pit BBQ - Charlotte, NC, United States. That&#39;s suppose to be chopped chicken and smoked turkey

VJs5EpFZdgqSFNjAdo-REQ.text: I have been to this airport many times but have never been here. I am generally here early in the morning and the breakfast they serve is actually pretty good. Today I got to try the BBQ for lunch. It was awesome! I have been to many stand alone barbecue restaurants that aren't as good as this airport location.  I got a two meat platter with chopped barbecue and chopped chicken. Both were juicy and moist and delicious. The macaroni and cheese and green beans were also both good. The cornbread was pretty dry so I couldn't finish it.   It's a little pricey, of course, but that's what happens in airports. If I am back in the airport for lunch or dinner, I will definitely be back.

vuUVVlZmjFZDh0rpNH2uGg.text: Whenever I pass through this airport I always make it a point to stop off and get a one meat pulled pork plate with mac and cheese and coleslaw and cornbread. Fried pickle is the best.

XlDdC-SKMWpcsUdc_YnCOw.text: As far as airport food goes, it was some of the best around.  I love the local feel and flavor.  Fast service and decent price (again, for airport pricing).
